Belgia.
[. M
r
B]
odely
Windebanke
Elizabeth R
By the Queene:
Trusty & welbeloved we greete you well. We have heertofore caused
o
r
Tresorer
of
England
to signifie unto
S
r
Thomas Morgan
, o
r
plea
s
r for the restoring of o
r
servant
Charles Chamberlen
to the place of Provost Marshall at
Berghen ap Zone
, wherof
because as yet we see not such performance as we expectid & assured o
r
self of, at S
r
Thomas Morgans hand
, we may remayn somwhat discontented therw
t
, considering that
though the disposing of that place be not in him, yet he might so have wrought w
t
the
States
that he might have procured Chamberlens restoring. we have therfore now bene
pleased to c
o
mitt theffecting of this matter to you. And th
r
fore we will & c
o
maund yo
u
as soone as conveniently ye may, to deale w
t
the Stat
generall or
C
o
nsell of State
,
or bothe if neede so require, & declare unto them o
r
ernest desire for o
r
said servant
restoring to the said place, both in respecte of his well deserving in service there, and
that allso we could ne
v
as yet heare any Just cause why he should be displaced
& an oth
r
called
Crook
[.]
farre meaner admitted to that office, between wh
o
and
Chamberlen we make greate difference, Chamberlen being a gentleman well borne,
howsoe
v
the oth
r
may be a good souldio
r
. Ye shall heerin deale so effectually
that according to the trust you knowe we repose in yo
u
, we may see th'effecte w
ch
we
meane to Chamberlen, declaring to the States how gratefull the same shall be to
us, & that we trust not to be refused in so small a matter. And to Morgan, you
shall saye that we know he hath meanes eyther by himself or oth
r
wise to procure
Crook
som oth
r
charge or place w
t
intertaynm
t
meete for him, w
ch
we wish he
might have, And that he shew all good favo
r
to Chamberlen, as one that shallbe
ready to any thing that he shall c
o
maund him for o
r
service, or that may c
o
cerne
himself.
Gyven under o
r
Signett at o
r
Palace of
West
m
the xxiiij
th
daye
of February
1591
, in the fowre and thirteth yeere of o
r
Raigne
